templates.2: {Name} is developing understanding of large numbers and decimals. {They} can work with these numbers with support but need reminders about place value relationships.
templates.3: {Name} demonstrates solid understanding of large numbers and decimals and can explain their place value with good accuracy.
templates.3plus: {Name} shows strong mastery of large numbers and decimals, confidently explaining place value patterns for any magnitude.

templates.2: {Name} is learning about prime and composite numbers. {They} can identify some examples but need support to sort and classify numbers consistently.
templates.3: {Name} explains properties of prime and composite numbers accurately and can sort sets with good independence.
templates.3plus: {Name} demonstrates strong understanding of prime and composite numbers, including explaining why zero and one are neither prime nor composite.

templates.2: {Name} is developing strategies to find multiples and factors. {They} can use repeated division and arrays with support.
templates.3: {Name} identifies multiples and factors of whole numbers and applies arrays, repeated division, and factor trees with growing independence.
templates.3plus: {Name} confidently explains strategies to find multiples and factors and applies them effectively to solve problems.

templates.2: {Name} is working on converting fractions to decimal equivalents. {They} can identify some patterns but need support with predictions.
templates.3: {Name} justifies examples of fractions to their decimal equivalents and sorts sets representing repeating and terminating decimals with good accuracy.
templates.3plus: {Name} predicts decimal representations of fractions using patterns and demonstrates strong understanding of fraction-decimal relationships.

templates.2: {Name} is developing understanding of percentages, ratios, and rates. {They} can represent these concepts with support but need reminders about the relationships.
templates.3: {Name} explains percentage indicators within the 0%-100% range and represents ratios and rates accurately in word and symbolic form.
templates.3plus: {Name} confidently expresses ratios as percentages and vice-versa, and solves rate, ratio, and percent problems with clear reasoning.

templates.2: {Name} is working on decimal operations. {They} can add and subtract decimals with support but need reminders to line up place values consistently.
templates.3: {Name} adds, subtracts, multiplies, and divides decimals to hundredths with good accuracy and estimates reasonably.
templates.3plus: {Name} confidently performs all decimal operations and justifies the reasonableness of solutions using place value principles.

templates.2: {Name} is developing skills with fraction operations. {They} can add and subtract fractions with common denominators but need support with mixed numbers.
templates.3: {Name} adds, subtracts, multiplies, and divides benchmark fractions and mixed numbers with growing independence and good accuracy.
templates.3plus: {Name} demonstrates strong understanding of fraction operations, simplifies fractions effectively, and justifies the reasonableness of solutions.

templates.2: {Name} is learning to apply the order of operations. {They} can solve problems with support but need reminders about the sequence.
templates.3: {Name} applies the order of operations to solve multi-step problems with whole numbers accurately.
templates.3plus: {Name} confidently applies the order of operations with and without technology and explains their reasoning clearly.

templates.2: {Name} is learning to collect and represent data. {They} can create questions and record results but need support selecting appropriate graph types.
templates.3: {Name} designs questionnaires, collects data, and justifies appropriate types of graphs for displaying collected data.
templates.3plus: {Name} confidently collects and represents data, interprets graphs effectively, and draws well-reasoned conclusions.

tablesGraphs.title: Tables of Values and Linear Graphs

templates.2: {Name} is working on creating tables and graphs. {They} can plot data with support but need reminders about patterns and relationships.
templates.3: {Name} creates and labels graphs from tables of values, calculates missing values, and describes patterns within columns accurately.
templates.3plus: {Name} confidently creates tables of values given linear relationships and explains which data sets can be represented by line graphs.

templates.2: {Name} is learning about the Cartesian Plane. {They} can plot points in the first quadrant with support but need reminders about ordered pairs.
templates.3: {Name} labels axes, identifies the origin, plots points using ordered pairs, and describes transformations of 2D shapes with good accuracy.
templates.3plus: {Name} confidently works with the Cartesian Plane, creates designs using 2D shapes, and describes rotations and reflections clearly.

probability.name: Statistics and Probability - Chance and Uncertainty

templates.2: {Name} is developing understanding of probability. {They} can determine simple probabilities with support but need help comparing theoretical and experimental results.
templates.3: {Name} determines theoretical probabilities, predicts experimental outcomes, and represents probabilities as ratios, fractions, and percentages.
templates.3plus: {Name} confidently conducts probability experiments, compares experimental and theoretical probabilities, and explains differences clearly.

templates.2: {Name} is learning to develop equations with variables. {They} can represent simple equations pictorially but need support with preservation of equality.
templates.3: {Name} develops equations using letter variables and the commutative property, and verifies the preservation of equality.
templates.3plus: {Name} confidently represents equivalent forms of equations and demonstrates strong understanding of the preservation of equality for all operations.

templates.2: {Name} is working on perimeter and area concepts. {They} can represent these measurements with support but need reminders about formulas.
templates.3: {Name} represents perimeter of polygons and area of rectangles, triangles, and parallelograms, and explains relationships between these measurements.
templates.3plus: {Name} confidently calculates perimeter and area, explains relationships clearly, and applies these concepts to solve problems.

templates.2: {Name} is developing understanding of volume. {They} can represent volume pictorially but need support understanding the relationship with area of the base.
templates.3: {Name} represents volume of right rectangular prisms and explains the relationship between base area and volume.
templates.3plus: {Name} confidently works with volume, demonstrates that orientation doesn't affect volume, and explains these concepts clearly.

templates.2: {Name} is learning about angles. {They} can estimate and classify angles with support but need practice using a protractor consistently.
templates.3: {Name} measures, creates, and labels angles using a protractor, classifies angles according to their measure, and understands angles as measures of rotation.
templates.3plus: {Name} confidently works with angles in various orientations and demonstrates understanding that the sum of interior angles is the same for all triangles and all quadrilaterals.

shapesObjects.name: Shape and Space - 2-D Shapes and 3-D Objects

templates.2: {Name} is learning about 3D objects. {They} can identify basic properties but need support describing parallel, perpendicular, and intersecting faces and edges.
templates.3: {Name} describes faces and edges using geometric language, sorts 3D objects by attributes, and constructs prisms using nets and skeletons.
templates.3plus: {Name} confidently describes 3D objects using precise language, provides real-world examples, and compares objects to identify attributes, orientations, and dimensions.

endingOptions: They have strong foundational skills and could excel with increased focus.
They consistently engage with lessons and contribute to class discussions.
They benefit from checking their work and taking time with multi-step tasks.
They are a curious learner who approaches mathematics with confidence.
They show growth in mathematical thinking and problem-solving strategies.
They work well independently and ask thoughtful questions when needed.
